result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sadiki Fadal Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sadiki Fadal Johnson in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Sadiki Fadal Johnson.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Parties are still in negotiations and are requesting an adjourned status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10.26.22

Defendant Sadiki Fadal Johnson in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Sadiki Fadal Johnson.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense received discovery and offer; defense requested more time to go over offer with defendant. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; IN PERSON. Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-19-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-19-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 9.9.22

Defendant Sadiki Fadal Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Sadiki Fadal Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Krueger. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Sadiki F. Johnson - #2022007564, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Sadiki Fadal Johnson in court in person with Attorney Fred Richardson who appears by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Attorney Richardson is unable to appear due to COVID exposure. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Sadiki Fadal Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant was not produced from Waukesha for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Case passed to verify information on PSA (father & son both in custody; same name).  case recalled at 9:36  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sadiki Fadal Johnson in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Sadiki Fadal Johnson in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sadiki Fadal Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
